byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Los Angeles, and Julie Turkewitz from Denver.
byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and JULIE TURKEWITZ

abstract: Pres Obama designates three new national monuments in California desert, nearly doubling amount of public land for which he has issued protections during his tenure as president; some Republican lawmakers criticize fact that Obama used executive power under Antiquities Act to make designations.
lead_paragraph: The move drew immediate rebuke from some Republicans, who have criticized the president’s aggressive use of executive action to protect lands.

headline.main: With 3 California Sites, Obama Nearly Doubles Public Land He’s Protected
headline.print_headline: With 3 New Sites in California, Obama Extends Protection of Public Land

snippet: The move drew immediate rebuke from some Republicans, who have criticized the president’s aggressive use of executive action to protect lands.
